text:
Students also took part in a signature campaign and undertook a pledge to cast their votes in a fair manner

Students taking part in a marathon run to create awareness on exercising voting rights in the May 2016 Assembly polls in Vellore. —Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

About 2,000 students from various colleges took part in a marathon run to create awareness on the right to vote on Friday.

The marathon was organised by the district administration to spread awareness among the public on the need to vote without fail, and to vote in a fair manner, in the May 16 Assembly elections. The run, which was flagged off by Collector R. Nanthagopal, commenced near the New Bus Terminus and ended at Nethaji Stadium.

Students from the Muthurangam Arts College, D.K.M. College for Women, Auxilium College, Thanthai Periyar Government Institute of Technology, Voorhees College and Bharath College of Education took part in the awareness run, a press release said.

On reaching the Nethaji Stadium, the students took part in a signature campaign and undertook a pledge to cast their votes in a fair manner.

Short films featuring film stars underscoring the need to vote were screened to the students through the publicity vehicle.

Need to motivate

Officials from the district administration said it would have been better if participation certificates had been given to the students.

“The students participated in the marathon with a lot of enthusiasm. Giving a certificate would definitely serve as a motivation for them. In fact, some colleges expected to get certificates and even asked the officials about it,” an official said.

title: Awareness marathon conducted to motivate voters
